intro: Monsonia maskatensis, commonly known as the Masked Monsonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Monsonia maskatensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
